go_data.justification: ASD-2 is an RNA-binding protein belonging to the STAR family.
ASD-2 regulates muscle-specific and developmentally regulated alternative splicing of the unc-60 gene.
Nuclei of body wall muscles are stained with an antibody against ASD-2b, indicating that ASD-2 is localized in the nucleus.
ASD-2 orthologs in other organisms are required for muscle development or activity, suggesting a similar role for ASD-2 in C. elegans.
